 You interpret my request that you follow the rules and post a link, flocking here in utter dismay on my part? How consistently irrational of you jason. Anyway, it seems that you are celebrating prematurely at this point since Congress must approve this move before it's a done deal.
 DC City Council votes to legalize gay marriage
 (AP) - 4 hours ago
 WASHINGTON - Washington D.C.'s City Council has voted to legalize gay marriage in the nation's capital.
 Mayor Adrian Fenty has promised to sign the bill, which was co-sponsored by 10 of the council's 13 members. The final vote Tuesday was 11-2.
 The bill now goes to Congress, which has final say over the district's laws. Opponents say they'll try to get Congress or voters to overturn it.
 Passage of the bill is a victory for gay marriage supporters, who have been dealt a recent string of defeats in Maine, New York and New Jersey.
 Gay marriage is legal in Massachusetts, Connecticut, Iowa and Vermont. New Hampshire will begin issuing licenses in January.
 If Congress doesn't reject the bill, D.C. should start issuing marriage licenses around St. Patrick's Day.The Associated Press: DC City Council votes to legalize gay marriage

So your religion/God/heaven endorses blaming victims for physical violence visited upon them if the perp was gay and insulting the good works of people if they happen to be gay. This is what you call spiritual enlightenment? I was raised to call that kind of thing bigotry.

If eternity does truly await me, no matter where, I have to live with myself through it. You, nor your damned God, has provided any reason to be hateful to these people. I could not stand myself for five minutes, let alone an eternity knowing I supported that kind of hate.

And on the contrary, both God and I have given many reasons why you should seek the truth if you chose to truly be spiritually free. You have shown that you prefer to wallow in the lies and deceptions of this worlds spiritual darkness though, and you will surely reap the harvest which comes with that journey. And don't be fooled Jito, you will surely hate and condemn yourself for the fate which awaits you. That's what makes it hell afterall. 
 
 You know, the regret, the knowledge that they had the opportunity to grasp unconditional love yet they squandered it and even fought against it as they hated those people who told them about the blessings that come with a relationship with the living God of life who made us in His image. If you had acquired any wisdom in this life, these truths would be self evident to you. But sadly, you have no such insights so you will enter eternity DOA.

We are carrying on the same argument in two places. I moved it all here.
 
 
In this post that may have been your current focus of criticism, as misguided as it is. But your general m.o. is to always defend the reprobates against the moral traditionalists. That is just where your loyalties lie Jito, and that's because you have no more solid a moral center than those you defend. 

 
 Can't you see how absolutely infantile and narrow-minded this stance is (not to mention hugely arrogant, you hardly know my opinion on every matter)? "If one does not have MY morality (on this one issue) they have none. If they don't think like ME (about this one issue) they are rebrobate." There is nothing wrong with my moral center. I simply do not use an ancient text to define it. I use real life. I pay attention to the actions of people and see who is causing whom harm. With that as my guide it is absolutely obvious that, according to my morality, you are in the wrong.
 
 As to what Sister said that I was responding to, I have posted it below. She claims that volunteering in the service is nothing and that Jazy's service in paricular is meaningless simply because he is gay.
 
 I know in the past you have said that homosexuality is no greater sin than many others so - put your money where your mouth is and tell me if you believe we should dismiss the service of all the men in women in the military since, according to your religion, all people are sinners? Tell me you would back someone who made this kind of insult to a heterosexual serviceman. Or maybe, just maybe, you can have the honesty to admit that your attitude against homosexuals is a little more than concern about a sinner.
 
 
Yeah. It cancelled it out when you decided to bend over frontwards, and backwards for the local men. Plus, you said possibly, did you actually go?! Or did you just volunteer and never was shipped out?! Because just volunteering means nothing.emoticon_rolleyes

 
 
And while we're at it, go ahead and prove that Jason ever actually served in the military, on this internet setting. Go on, I challenge you to prove anything he says is true true in reality in any way? 

 
 As soon as you prove that the personal stuff you have bothered to share about yourself isn't anything but a pack full of lies. Prove you are happily married Christian man who loves his family. Maybe you are just some nutter who eats babies for breakfast.
 
 I will take everyone in here at their word unless there is evidence not to. And even if he were not telling the truth and never served, there are plenty of homosexuals who do and Sister's comments are still out of line.
 
 
What? What are you incoherently rambling on about now, because I have no idea what you are attempting to align me with. What does this statement even mean? So your religion/God/heaven endorses blaming victims for physical violence visited upon them if the perp was gay and insulting the good works of people if they happen to be gay.  And point out via quotes where I have endorsed any violence or oppression against homosexuals in any way rather than just making blanket condemnations which assume I endorse violence against anyone at all for any reason.

 
 I am rambling about what is implied below and in your comments about the hypothetical situation where someone wearing a gay pride shirt gets beat up. You say that you condemn violence against anyone out one side of your mouth while out of the other you insinuate that if they were gay they had it coming.
 
 
And I'm not doubting he did join the navy and get beaten up by his fellow soldiers. But I don't believe they attacked him as a gang because he was just a selfless homosexual as he claims to be. I believe he made an inappropriate pass to one or more of these guys and they just had enough of him so they set out to teach him a lesson. If there's one thing I have learned in this life, there are two sides to every story. So just hearing the version from a homosexual who is proven to be biased and dishonest in their objectivity leaves me unsure of what part of his testimony to believe, if any of it.

 
 
Oh please Jito. In every post you write, you attempt to dishonestly blame me for the reason you aren't a born again believer in God through Christ Jesus, our Lord, and I have been dealing with you for years on 2 different forums. You are so manipulative and dishonest that you must attempt to blame me for your spiritual condition. How disingenuous can you be to blame me for your hatred for anything right and good in this world as you always promote and defend the lowest moral common denominator in life. You are as spiritually dead and reprobate as those values which you defend here so stop blaming me for your spiritual condition, because neither I nor anyone else can ever prevent you from seeking a higher truth if that is what you chose. emoticon_rolleyes

 
 Please, you give yourself far too much credit. I blame you for nothing. You are hardly important enough in my life to have been the cause of anything. You are simply a handy reminder. 
 
 
Be assured Jito that eternity does await you. Of that there is no doubt. If you were even half as enlightened as you claim to be, you would know this without any question at all.  No doubt, huh? You and the maker chat on the phone this morning? Did he tell you himself, "hey man, that Leslie chic, I am gonna SO fry her"? Speaking for the good lord yourself; this an example of that Christian humility?
